intro: Adenolobus rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed adenolobus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Adenolobus rufescens is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
